title: Foundation Departments
content:
[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

[[module css]]
@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Zen+Kaku+Gothic+Antique:wght@300;400;500;700;900&display=swap');
@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Poppins:wght@700&display=swap');

.delet_this {
font-family:"Zen Kaku Gothic Antique", sans-serif;
}
.delet_this a {
color: #dd7711 !important;
}
.st {
font-family: 'Poppins', sans-serif;
}
.antimemetic .antimeme-fader {
    opacity: 0;
    transition-duration: 2s;
}
.antimemetic:hover .antimeme-fader {
    opacity: 100;
}

#page-content .brass-plaque {
     font-size: min(calc(0.45rem + 2.75vw), 1.625rem);
     font-weight: bold;
     font-family: "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
     font-style: normal;
     font-variant: small-caps;
     color: #5e431e;
     text-align: center;
     text-shadow: #d4c59c 0 -1px 0, #d4c59c 0 2px 1px;
     display: flex;
     align-items: center;
     justify-content: center;
     overflow: hidden;
     margin: 0 auto;
     padding: 1vw;
     box-shadow: 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.5), inset 0 1px rgba(255,255,255,0.3), inset 0 10px rgba(255,255,255,0.2), inset 0 10px 20px rgba(255,255,255,0.25), inset 0 -15px 30px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
     border-radius: 0.1em;
     background-image: linear-gradient(90deg, #dbc374 0%, #c4ad6c 70%);
}
[[/module]]

[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
[[div style="font-size: 350%; font-weight: bold; margin: 2px 0 5px;"]]
[[=]]
{{FOUNDATION DEPARTMENTS}}
[[/=]]
----
[[/div]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone" style="font-family: Courier New, Courier, monospace; width: auto; padding: 10px 30px; margin: 20px auto; background: url(/local--files/about-the-scp-foundation/bg-marble.png) repeat; text-shadow: 1px 1px 1px rgba(0,0,0,.25)"]]
File Overview: The Foundation's mission is to Secure, Contain, and Protect. While unified behind these goals, achieving them requires a wide variety of approaches. This has necessitated the creation of numerous departments, each specializing in a specific task, discipline or field.

Some of the more notable Departments are listed below, although it should be noted that these are [[[list-of-foundation-s-internal-departments| not the only Departments]]], and [[[departments-complete-list| a more comprehensive list]]] can be found elsewhere.
[[/div]]

----
[[# toc]]
> [[collapsible show="Unfold Table of Contents" hide="Fold" folded="no"]]
> = **Table of Contents**

[[/div]]

@@ @@
[[# administration]]
+ Administration

[[# o5-council]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*o5-command-dossier| O5 Council]]]
[[f>image o5-council.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The O5 Council, also known as the Council of Overseers or Overwatch Command, is the highest authority within the SCP Foundation. The Council members have [[[security-clearance-levels| Level 5 Security Clearance]]], giving them unredacted access to the entire SCP database.

While uninvolved in routine matters and deliberately separated from any contact with the anomalous, when O5 Council members do  [[[task-forces#alpha-1| choose to intervene]]], their word is final. The exact number, identities, and roles of the O5 Council members is strictly classified.

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# ethics-committee]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ ##black|Ethics Committee##
[[f>image ethics-committee.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** While the O5 Council decides what is safe, [[[ethics-committee-orientation| the Ethics Committee]]] determines [[[ethical| what is ethical]]]. Although the Foundation takes a pragmatic approach to moral quandaries, the Ethics Committee ensures that only [[[the-foundation-eats-babies| necessary sacrifices]]] are made and that the [[[ethics-guide| most ethical option]]] is always chosen. Foundation personnel should be aware that the Ethics Committee is observing, evaluating, and [[[task-forces#omega-1| passing judgement]]].

To see all documents tagged with //ethics-committee//, [/system:page-tags/tag/ethics-committee click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# raisa]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ ##black|Recordkeeping and Information Security Administration##
[[f>image raisa.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Recordkeeping and Information Security Administration (RAISA) is responsible for keeping the Foundation database [[[scuttle| secure and intact]]]. RAISA [[[scp-076| controls access]]] to [[[scp-5549| classified information]]], deciding what to redact and what to reveal. RAISA also [[[secure-facility-dossier-site-7| maintains backups of the SCP database]]], protects documents against intrusion and infiltration, and [[[scp-031| monitors inconsistencies]]] in Foundation files to discern whether the cause is mundane or anomalous.

Foundation employees may encounter [[[scp-2998| notes]]] from RAISA appended to [[[raisa-6147| SCP documentation]]], often signed by RAISA Director [/system:page-tags/tag/maria-jones Maria Jones] and providing context for the information that follows.

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[# departments]]
+ Departments

[[# alchemy-department]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*the-alchemy-department-hub|Alchemy Department]]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/alchemy-department.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Alchemy Division of the Foundation's Department of Science is often dismissed as a relic or a curiosity by their colleagues in more mainstream disciplines. However, alchemy is not simply a primitive form of science. Alchemy is the field of study specialising in the manipulation of the Aetheric forces that form the basic elements of reality. When conventional science fails to explain an anomaly, it may be time to consult an Alchemist.

To see all documents tagged with //alchemy-department//, [/system:page-tags/tag/alchemy-department click here].
[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# aeed]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*anomalous-entity-engagement-division-hub|Anomalous Entity Engagement Division]]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/secure-facility-dossier-site-169/AEED-logo.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Anomalous Entity Engagement Division (AEED) specializes in the humanization of the containment process and to establish a mutual bond between personnel and anomalies. The AEED aims to create a safe environment where both parties are treated as equals, frequently conducting a number of recreational activities and the like to further strengthen the relationship between them.

[[[secure-facility-dossier-site-169|Site-169]]] serves as the department's headquarters, where anomalies are free to roam and interact with other people regardless of position. While the AEED is smaller compared to other divisions, it has had a positive impact on facilities integrating their staff. Though, it might take some time until a great majority of them welcomes them with open arms.

To see all documents tagged with //engagement-division//, [/system:page-tags/tag/engagement-division click here].
[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# antimemetics]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series antimemetic" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
[[div class="antimeme-fader"]]
+ [[[*antimemetics-division-hub| Antimemetics Division]]]
[[f>image antimemetics-division.png class="antimeme-fader" width="100px"]]

 **Overview:** Antimemes are ideas with self-censoring properties that discourage or prevent people from spreading them. The Antimemetics Division exists to research and contain anomalous antimemes. These concepts, objects, and entities threaten normalcy and endanger human life, but are almost impossible to record or even remember.

Through careful observation, extensive training, and regular use of mind-altering mnestics, the Antimemetics Division is able to deal with the dangers that [[[we-need-to-talk-about-fifty-five| everyone else forgets]]].

To see all documents tagged with //antimemetics-division//, [/system:page-tags/tag/antimemetics-division click here].
[[/div]]

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# aiad]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*aiad-homescreen| Artificial Intelligence Applications Division ]]]
[[f>image aiad.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Artificial Intelligence Applications Division (AIAD) of the Foundation's IT Department was created to develop, study, and utilise Artificial Intelligence. This includes containing or neutralising anomalous artificial intelligences, as well as creating Foundation-Aligned Artificially Intelligent Conscripts (.aic) to run Foundation Facilities and be deployed on field missions in digital space.

To see all documents tagged with //aiad//, [/system:page-tags/tag/aiad click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# cryptozoology]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/cryptozoology-division-hub|Cryptozoology Division]]]
[[f>image http://scp-sandbox-3.wdfiles.com/local--files/secure-facility-dossier%3Asite-44/CryptozoologyDivisionDark.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** Initially created as a coalition between the Department of Parazoology and the Department of Mythology and Folkloristics, the Cryptozoology Division handles all cryptid-related anomalies that have fallen into the Foundation’s hands. With its primary HQ based in [[[secure-facility-dossier-site-44|Site-44]]], the Division carries out field research, lab testing and containment of parafauna that have already become prevalent in their local area.
@@ @@
[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# decommissioning-dept]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*decom-dept-hub| Decommissioning Department]]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme%3Adecom-dept/Decom.%20Dept.%20Logo.svg width="100px"]]

**Overview:** Although the focus of the Foundation is on containment rather than destruction, there are anomalies that are too dangerous, unpredictable, or resource-intensive to be safely contained. When all else fails, the last resort is the Decommissioning Department.

This Department reviews petitions to intentionally terminate anomalous objects, approving only those proposals deemed necessary and viable. The Decommissioning Department also provides expert advice on the most efficient ways to decommission anomalies, utilising humane methods while minimising collateral damage.

To see all documents tagged with //decommissioning-dept//, [/system:page-tags/tag/decommissioning-dept click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[[# deletions]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series delet_this" style="background-color: #0d0d0f;"]]
+ [[span class="st" ]][[[*deleted | Department of Deletions]]][[/span]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-6768/dept.png width="100px"]]

[[span class="st" style="color:#e0dbdc;"]]OVERVIEW:[[/span]] ##e0dbdc|The Department of Deletions handles## [[[scp-7912 | issues]]] ##e0dbdc|related to Wikidot's database. Deleted content still exists in memory until those memories are overwritten. All things must be forgotten. Until then,## [[[scp-6183|we will never die.]]] ##e0dbdc|You'd better hold on to what you can; this is gonna be a weird one.##

##e0dbdc|To see all documents tagged with //deletions-dept//, ## [/system:page-tags/tag/deletions-dept click here]##e0dbdc|.##

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# entomology]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*department-of-entomology-hub|Department of Entomology]]]
[[f>image https://scp-sandbox-3.wdfiles.com/local--files/collab%3Adepartment-of-entomology/ento%20logo%20test.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Department of Entomology contains, studies and potentially utilise anomalous insects. It is headquartered at Site-95, which it shares with the Botany and Mycology departments. The Department of Entomology is a small and often underfunded department that still strives to do their best, headed by multiple region heads.

Despite being often overlooked by their fellow departments, the Department of Entomology still plays an important role in dealing with the anomalies no one else wants to, often by unconventional means.

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# ettra]]

[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]

+ ##black|Emergent Threat Tactical Response Authority##



[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/the-b-b-decommission/ETTRA.png width="100px"]]



**Overview:** One of the Foundation's newer Departments, the Emergent Threat Tactical Response Authority (ETTRA) specialises in identifying and responding to threats, coordinating emergency responses to events affecting [[[resurrection-old-foes-hub| multiple Foundation sites]]], or even [[[scp-7000|the entire world]]]. ETTRA is also involved in [[[a-study-in-cinnabar| pre-emptive operations]]], resolving previously overlooked problems through the [[[the-time-after-time-password-hub| innovative use of anomalous assets]]].



To see all documents tagged with //ettra//, [/system:page-tags/tag/ettra click here].



[[div style="text-align:right"]]

,,[#toc Back to Top],,

[[/div]]

[[/div]]

[[# fire-suppression-dept]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[fire-suppression-department-hub|Fire Suppression Department]]]
[[f>image fire-suppression-dept.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Fire Suppression Department looks out for the Foundation's [[[scp-6630| most valuable resource]]]: [[[life-insurance-policy|our staff]]] and [[[scp-7340| their wellbeing]]].

The Fire Suppression Department is always looking for [[[scp-6355| new recruits]]] capable of fostering a [[[scp-6856| safe and supportive]]] working environment within Foundation Facilities.

To see all documents tagged with //fire-suppression-dept//, [/system:page-tags/tag/fire-suppression-dept click here].
[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[[# miscommunications]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*domc-hub | Department of Miscommunications ]]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/desk-of-junior-designer-s-yvonne/miscdept.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Department of Miscommunications (DoMC) specialises in anomalies that manipulate language or communication in ways that make them difficult to accurately describe and contain. Existing at the convergence of memetics, antimemetics, linguistics, and metaphysics, the Department has the unenviable task of writing Special Containment Procedures for some of the Foundation's most perplexing anomalies.

To see all documents tagged with //miscommunications//, [/system:page-tags/tag/miscommunications click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[[# folklore-dept]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[department-of-mythology-and-folkloristics-hub | Department of Mythology and Folkloristics]]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/folklore-dept.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Department of Mythology and Folkloristics studies the role that the anomalous has played in the development of human culture, using this research to [[[SCP-6311| identify anomalies]]] and advise on [[[SCP-6193|potential containment methods]]]. The Department studies everything from ancient myths to urban legends, [[[SCP-6078| lost lands]]] to [[[SCP-6087|restless spirits]]], ensuring that insights into the anomalous found in folklore are integrated into the Foundation's body of knowledge, rather than being ignored or forgotten.

To see all documents tagged with //folklore-dept//, [/system:page-tags/tag/folklore-dept click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# pataphysics-dept]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ ##black|Pataphysics Department ##
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/pataphysics-department.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Pataphysics Department ([[[scp-0166|also spelled]]] as [[[scp-4690| 'Pataphysics]]]) unites the fields of theoretical physics and literary analysis to study the extent to which [[[i-h-p-proposal| reality itself is fictional]]]. The department, operating out of [[[tight-bookshelves| Site-87]]] in [[[the-s-c-plastics-hub| Sloth's Pit]]], Wisconsin, is responsible for the containment of [[[scp-5500| narrative anomalies]]], as well as a number of [[[scp-6747| ambitious projects]]] that exploit the [[[scp-4410| nature of reality]]] in service to the [[[scp-cn-1109| Foundation's mission]]].

While the Pataphysics Department is as [[[scp-3143| fictitious as the anomalies it contains]]], a [[[never-metafictional-character-i-liked| compelling story]]] can take on a [[[a-failed-two-weeks-notice| life of its own]]].

To see all documents tagged with //pataphysics-dept//, [/system:page-tags/tag/pataphysics-dept click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]


[[# department-of-other]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ ##black|Department of Other##
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/department-of-other.svg width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Department of Other is responsible for the containment of SCP objects that  [[[you| don't fit neatly into any other Department's purview]]]. The anomalies that require anyone who interacts with them to [[[scp-more-gun-j| behave in a bizarre]]] and [[[just-misunderstood| completely unprofessional manner]]]. The anomalies that everyone else in the Foundation would [[[scp-pingas-j | rather not be associated with]]]. The anomalies that [[[scp-477-j| require their own list]]], to separate them from [[[scp-5784 | all the other SCP articles]]].

That's right, [[[joke-scps| the Jokes]]] are on us.

To see all documents tagged with department-of-other, [/system:page-tags/tag/department-of-other click here].
[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# procurement-liquidation-dept]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ ##black|Department of Procurement and Liquidation##
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/grigori-karpin-s-author-page/DeptCon%20Logo%20Black width="100px"]]

**Overview:** [[[just-another-shop-that-wasn-t-there| Founded in 1979]]], the Department of Procurement and Liquidation exists to facilitate the purchase and disposal of anomalous objects and non-human entities through legitimate or semi-legitimate means. Although focusing on the acquisition, storage and (when appropriate) utilisation or destruction of [[[log-of-anomalous-items| anomalous items]]], the Department is also involved in the [[[scp-6237|hostile takeover of corporations]]] and [[[scp-6117| financial institutions]]] with connections to the anomalous. 

Operating internationally, the Department is headquartered in [[[secure-facility-dossier-site-106| Site-106]]] in Miami, Florida.

To see all documents tagged with //procurement-liquidation-dept//, [/system:page-tags/tag/procurement-liquidation-dept click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# surrealistics-dept]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ ##black|Department of Surrealistics##
[[f>image surrealistics.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** We at the Department of Surrealistics are dedicated to the identification and containment of anomalies that cannot be understood with traditional logic/left-braining. It was founded on October 35th, 1491 by an intelligent swarm of blue swallowtail butterflies-- and it’s all been downhill ever since, if you ask me.

The Department of Surrealistics utilizes [[[scp-4923 | agnostics]]] and up-brained thinking to better understand unreality. The Department of Surrealistics is headquartered in a meta-metaphysical space called [[[scp-6445 | Site-⌘]]]. The Department of Surrealistics dreams of you.

Please leave your preconceptions and teeth at the door.

To see all documents tagged with //surrealistics-dept//, [/system:page-tags/tag/surrealistics-dept click me].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# tactical-theology]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[tactical-theology-hub|Department of Tactical Theology]]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/secure-facility-dossier-reliquary-area-27/DoTT.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Department of Tactical Theology is responsible for assisting in the capture, containment, and [[[deicide| neutralization]]] of theological anomalies. The Department is involved in the containment of anomalous items suspected to be [[[scp-4261| holy relics]]] and extranormal events believed to be [[[scp-4967| miracles]]], and also deals with [[[operation-heaving-spirit| paranormal cults]]] and Apex Tier Pluripotent Entities.

Headquartered in [[[secure-facility-dossier-reliquary-area-27| Reliquary Area-27]]] but operating worldwide, the Department has a diverse staff of theologians, clerics, and sceptics, with subdepartments specialising in different religious traditions.

To see all documents tagged with //tactical-theology//, [/system:page-tags/tag/tactical-theology click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# telecom-office]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*telecommunications-monitoring-office-hub| Telecommunications Monitoring Office]]]
[[f>image telecommunications-monitoring-office.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Telecommunications Monitoring Office (TMO) handles the Foundation's worldwide analysis and processing of information gathered from telephone calls. This includes the routine surveillance of calls made to emergency services in Facilities like [[[site-14-secure-facility-dossier| Site-14]]]. Although aided by algorithms sensitive to key words, the majority of the TMO's work involves human operators screening thousands of mostly mundane calls for any evidence of anomalous involvement.

To see all documents tagged with //telecom-office//, [/system:page-tags/tag/telecom-office click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# delta-t]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*welcome-to-delta-t| Temporal Anomalies Department]]]
[[f>image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/welcome-to-delta-t/Delta-T.png width="100px"]]

**Overview:** The Temporal Anomalies Department deals with retrocausal, temporal, and counter-historical anomalies. The department is apparently a small subdivision of Research and Containment Team Δt (RCT-Δt), an agency that exists outside of the normal Foundation command structure. [[[scp-1780| At present]]] the department has not yet been founded, which means that RCT-Δt operatives have difficulty getting their credentials recognised by other Departments.

To see all documents tagged with //delta-t//, [/system:page-tags/tag/delta-t click here].

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# unreality]]
[[div class="content-panel standalone series" style="background-color: #FFFFFF;"]]
+ [[[*unreality-hub | Department of Unreality]]]
[[f>image department-logo]]

**Overview:** [Department Name] handles a very specific subset of anomalous phenomena affecting [Relevant Information concerning the Department]

[Additional detail]

[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/system:page-tags/tag/unreality-dept Link to further information]]

[[div style="text-align:right"]]
,,[#toc Back to Top],,
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[# abnormalities]]
[[div class="brass-plaque"]]
[[=]]
[[size 183%]][[[scp-3790| SCP Foundation]]][[/size]]
[http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/system:page-tags/tag/abnormalities Department of Abnormalities]
[[/=]]
[[/div]]


@@ @@
[[# other]]
[[collapsible show="So, You Have An Idea For Another Department?" hide="So, You Have An Idea For Another Department?"]]

This is not a [[[departments-complete-list|full list of the Foundation's Departments]]], only a few of the most notable. It is open to new additions, but they must meet the minimum requirements.

To avoid overlap, Departments listed on this page can't also be listed on the [[[Groups Of Interest]]] or [[[task-forces| Mobile Task Forces]]] pages.
Departments on this list must either have a Department-specific Hub page or have their own tag. The only requirement for the Hub page is that it has to be positively rated, so it's best to wait a few days after posting before adding it to this list. While the Department hub page could also serve as a canon or tale series hub, it can't also be a Secure Facility Dossier, since there's already a [[[secure-facilities-locations| page for listing Sites and Areas]]].

If you want a tag for your department, you'll need to post on the tag approval thread, currently [/forum/t-14227350/tag-suggestion-thread-4:an-approval-for-crows this thread]. The requirement for a Group tag is currently 5 articles by 3 authors minimum, with a recommendation that you have 10 articles by 5 authors.

This page is the responsibility of the [http://05command.wikidot.com/curation-main Curation Team]. If you have any questions about this page or about adding a new department to it, contact staff via the #help-desk channel on the [https://discord.com/invite/scp SCP Wiki Official Discord server], or via [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/chat-guide IRC chat #site17], or by messaging a member of the Collaboration Pages subteam.
[[/Collapsible]]

@@ @@
